original_title: 10,579 km: A Queer Journey from Damascus to Vancouver
overview: As an activist in the underground LGBTQ community in Syria, Danny Ramadan faced imminent persecution by the Syrian regime that led him to escape Damascus and eventually make his way to Vancouver. Danny shares his experience as a newcomer, delving into racism and privilege within the queer community, and offers his views on how we can be allies to Syrian refugees.
title: 10,579 km: A Queer Journey from Damascus to Vancouver
